intro: Scabiosa mixta, commonly known as the common scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. The plant produces clusters of small, rounded flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, providing a textured appearance. Scabiosa mixta is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and as a nectar source for pollinators.
